docs.text: Welcome to MkDocs For full documentation visit mkdocs.org . Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit. Project layout mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: Development Here you can put instructions on how to get started with Development. This should be as simple and clear as can be. Example: Clone the repository $ git clone In the folder X, install the plugin to your local repository ./gradlew publishToMavenLocal In settings.gradle.kts, configure Gradle to look after local plugins (this has to be first in the file) pluginManagement { repositories { mavenLocal() gradlePluginPortal() // maven(url="https://dl.bintray.com/kotlin/dokka") } } Apply the plugin in a project of your choice, this? plugins { id("se.svt.oss.:a-plugin") version "0.1.0-SNAPSHOT" } Configure it if you want to versionsFilter { exclusiveQualifiers = listOf("rc", "alpha", "beta", "m") } Run ./gradlew dependencyUpdates
docs.title: Development
